gw.plugin.document

Interface IDocumentProduction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    com.guidewire.pl.plugin.document.internal.BaseDocumentProductionDispatcher, BaseDocumentProductionImpl, BaseExcelDocumentProductionImpl, BaseGosuDocumentProductionImpl, BaseMailMergeDocumentProductionImpl, BaseServerSideDocumentProductionImpl, BaseServerSidePDFDocumentProductionImpl, BaseWordDocumentProductionImpl, DocumentProductionDispatcher, ExcelDocumentProductionImpl, GosuDocumentProductionImpl, ServerSideExcelDocumentProduction, ServerSidePDFDocumentProductionImpl, ServerSideWordDocumentProduction, WordDocumentProductionImpl

    public interface IDocumentProduction
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    An interface to a Document Production system. This interface will be used to create documents both synchronously and asynchronously, and both as a direct result of user action and from rules (or other Gosu). Synchronous creation means that the document contents are generated immediately and returned to the calling method for further processing. In this scenario, the caller is responsible for persisting the document to the DMS system (if desired). Asynchronous creation means that the document contents may not be generated for some time, or may require extra workflow processing and/or manual intervention. The contents of the document are not returned, although a URL or other information allowing the checking of state may be, and the IDocumentProduction implementation is responsible for adding the document to the DMS system and notifying the Guidewire software upon successful completion of the document.
    Author:
    bjohnson

      • createDocumentAsynchronously

        java.lang.String createDocumentAsynchronously(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor templateDescriptor,
                                              java.util.Map parameters,
                                              java.util.Map fieldValues)
        Attempt to create a document in an asynchronous manner.
        Parameters:
        templateDescriptor - The template from which to create the document.
        parameters - Any objects which may be required for document creation (for context object values, for example)
        fieldValues - A name->value Map of values which should be set in the new Document's metadata, once it is created
        Returns:
        A URL which the user could visit to see the status of the document creation, or null if none exists

      • createDocumentSynchronously

        DocumentContentsInfo createDocumentSynchronously(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor templateDescriptor,
                                                 java.util.Map parameters,
                                                 Document document)
        Create a document synchronously from a document template. "Synchronously" means that the document contents should be contained in the return value, and the caller is responsible for persisting the document metadata.
        Parameters:
        templateDescriptor - the descriptor which should be used to create the new document
        parameters - An optional Map of name->object pairs which may be used either to create the document or perform extra operations (such as mailing the resulting document to recipients). May be empty or null.
        document - An in/out parameter. Contains the metadata set up for the document so far, and which may be modified by the plugin implementation
        Returns:
        a DocumentContentsInfo object which contains the results of the document creation.
